intro: Elatine hydropiper proles major, commonly known as the water pepper, is a small aquatic plant belonging to the family Elatinaceae. It is characterized by its tiny, clustered leaves and stems that often grow in shallow water or moist soil. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or white in color. It is adapted to wet environments and can thrive in both freshwater and brackish conditions. Elatine hydropiper proles major is often found in marshes, ditches, and along the edges of ponds and streams.
